greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Filter sequence for a(prime) = constant sequences.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A239968.
In the following, A stands for this sequence, A305800, and S -> T (where S and T are sequence A-numbers) indicates that for all i, j: S(i) = S(i) => T(i) = T(j).
For example, the following implications hold:
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
formula: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, a(n) = 2 for prime n, and a(n) = 1+n-A000720(n) for composite n.
xref: Differs from A296073 for the first time at n=125, as a(125) = 96, while A296073(125) = 33.
Cf. also A305900, A305801, A295300, A289626 for other "upper level" filters.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 14 2018
